pkgmetadata.longdescription: ========QuickAPI========Is an easy way to setup mechanism calls for Django projects. For the exchange of data is used JSON. The API is built on the RPC scheme: one URL address - many methods. This scheme allows you to share hard-structured data, such as nested into each other JavaScript objects:.. code-block:: javascript $.quickAPI({ url: "/api/", data: { method: "settings.update", kwargs: { value: { suppliers: ['s1', 's2', 's33'], skip_goods: { s1: ['g123', 'g321'], s33: ['g098'] } } } }, callback: function(json, status, xhr) {}, }).. code-block:: python from quickapi.client import BaseClient api = BaseClient() api.url = 'https://example.org/api/' api.username = 'login' api.password = 'passw' settings = { 'suppliers': ['s1', 's2', 's33'], 'skip_goods': { 's1': ['g123', 'g321'], 's33': ['g098'] } } response = api.method('settings.update', value=settings)Read the documentation_ for details... _documentation: https://docs.rosix.org/django-quickapi/
